text: In vivo intracellular <extra_id_0> GrB <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and IFNgamma staining of activated <extra_id_0> CD8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + T cells

<extra_id_0> Granzyme B <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> GrB <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) and IFNgamma expressing <extra_id_0> CD8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + T cells were determined by treating the mice intranasally with 50 microg Brefeldin A ( Sigma ) as previously described [ 86 ] .

6 h later , BAL and lungs were isolated and single cell suspensions were prepared from the lung in the presence of 3 microg / ml Brefeldin A . Cells were stained , fixed and permeabilized ( Cytofix / Cytoperm , BD Biosciences ) according to the manufacturer 's instructions .

Activated <extra_id_0> CD8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + T cells were analyzed by flow cytometry based on CD62lo <extra_id_0> CD3 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + and <extra_id_0> CD8 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> + expression .
Live / Dead fixable aqua dead cell stain kit ( Molecular Probes ) was used to discriminate live from dead cells .
